alert.note: Alert for Northern Jackson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 6:16AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Jackson County through 645 AM CDT... At 616 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing funnel clouds 14 miles northwest of Vancleave, or 19 miles north of St. Martin, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...If a funnel cloud briefly touches down, minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Jackson County. FUNNEL CLOUDS...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until noon CDT for southern Mississippi.
